info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 01 at 8:35AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. * WHAT...SPECIAL AVALANCHE ADVISORY * WHERE...CAIC Aspen and Gunnison zones * WHEN...Beginning 8:00AM Saturday January 1. Expires at 8:00AM Monday January 3. * IMPACTS...Backcountry avalanche conditions are unusually dangerous. You can easily trigger avalanches large enough to bury or kill you. You could trigger these avalanches on all aspect and elevations and from below or adjacent steep slopes. You may not see signs of instability such as cracking and collapsing to indicate danger. Near structures. Every few years someone is killed in Colorado by snow sliding ofv a steep roof. Roof avalanche are possible if you find more than about 2 feet of snow sitting on a steep roof. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Backcountry travelers should plan to take extra precautions. Stay off and out from under slopes steeper than about 30 degrees over the next few days. Avoid crossing under steep roof lines. Consult www.colorado.gov/avalanche for detailed information. Cooperstein
